DataElement.preferredName: Clinical Significant Comorbidity Other Type Disease Diagnosis Other Specify
DataElement.preferredDefinition: The free-text field to specify other clinically significant co-existing disease(s).

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: Relating to the examination and treatment of patients dependent on direct observation.  The term may also refer to the institution (clinic) providing this activity._A term applied to differences, correlations, cause-and-effect relationships, etc., to indicate that they are noticeable, probably too closely correlated to be attributed to chance and therefore indicating a systematic relation: substantial, fairly large; also having consequence or import, important in effect or meaning. In statistics significant ordinarily indicates a probability of not less than 95 percent, while highly significant indicates a probability of not less than 99 percent._The coexistence of two or more disease processes._Different than the one(s) previously specified or mentioned._Something distinguishable as an identifiable class based on common qualities.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: Having to do with the examination and treatment of patients.:A term applied to differences, correlations, cause-and-effect relationships, etc., to indicate that they are noticeable, probably too closely correlated to be attributed to chance and therefore indicating a systematic relation: substantial, fairly large; also having consequence or import, important in effect or meaning. In statistics significant ordinarily indicates a probability of not less than 95 percent, while highly significant indicates a probability of not less than 99 percent.:The coexistence of two or more disease processes.

Concepts.definition: Relating to the examination and treatment of patients dependent on direct observation.  The term may also refer to the institution (clinic) providing this activity.

A term applied to differences, correlations, cause-and-effect relationships, etc., to indicate that they are noticeable, probably too closely correlated to be attributed to chance and therefore indicating a systematic relation: substantial, fairly large; also having consequence or import, important in effect or meaning. In statistics significant ordinarily indicates a probability of not less than 95 percent, while highly significant indicates a probability of not less than 99 percent.
The coexistence of two or more disease processes.

Property.preferredDefinition: Different than the one(s) previously specified or mentioned. (NCI):A subdivision of a particular kind of thing.

Concepts.definition: Different than the one(s) previously specified or mentioned.
Something distinguishable as an identifiable class based on common qualities.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Specification of human conditions relevant to cancer. This includes observations, test results, history, and other concepts relevant to characterization of human cancer-related conditions. Non-neoplastic conditions of interest are also included.

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: the text field to describe a disease diagnosis not otherwise listed.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: the process of identifying a disease by the signs and symptoms (NCI Glossary).

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: Not otherwise specified.:Specify; be specific about something; define clearly.

Concepts.definition: Different than the one(s) previously specified or mentioned.
Be specific about something; define clearly.

ClassificationSchemes.longName: Artificial Neural Network Algorithm for BRIDG Mapping

ReferenceDocuments.name: Specify the other type of cli
ReferenceDocuments.description: Specify the other type of clinically significant comorbidity:

ReferenceDocuments.name: BRIDG mapping path for CDE:2737638
ReferenceDocuments.description: "PerformedDiagnosis [primary] > AssessedResultRelationship > PerformedObservation [assessment] > AssessedResultRelationship > PerformedDiagnosis.resultClassification(ANY=>CD).originalText [secondary] WHERE  PerformedDiagnosis.value [primary] = ""Acute Myelogenous Leukemia(AML)"" OR ""Chronic Myelogenous Leukemia(CML)"" OR ""Myelodysplasia Syndrome(MDS)""  AND PerformedDiagnosis [primary] > PerformedProcedure [overall HCT process] AND PerformedObservation [assessment] > PerformedClinicalInterpretation.value = ""CoMorbid"" AND PerformedClinicalInterpretation.clinicallySignificantIndicator = ""true"" AND PerformedObservation [assessment] > DefinedObservation.nameCode = ""Assess Comorbidity and Clinical Significance"" AND PerformedDiagnosis.resultClassification(ANY=>CD).nullFlavor = ""OTH"" [secondary]"

DataElement.changeDescription: . Added alt name/ASQT for 2400. AK 10/8/13 Added human readable def. System generated def displayed as alt def. No version needed. AK 11/12/14 Field name added for 5000. AK 9/13/16
